oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Epidemiological Evaluation of Breeding Soundness Examinations in Beef Bulls: Effects of the Revised Standards
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, Kammy R.
Dewey, Cate E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breeding soundness
breeding soundness examination
beef herds
artificial insemination
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Breeding soundness is a crucial criterion when selecting or maintaining bulls for breeding stock. The breeding soundness examination (BSE) is a commonly used tool for bull selection, retention, and usage in beef herds and artificial insemination centers. Ten to twenty percent of bulls evaluated fail the BSE according to the criteria previously set forth by the Society for Theriogenology.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1995; 221
